page.title: 15A Day Out.
page.content: The not_very_famous Three Counties Show was a great success.This is an annual union of Herefordshire, Worcestershire, and Gloucestershire. The reconstruction of the legendary Ambridge Village, home of the Archers, boosted its success. The Archers were actually there, along with a village pond, with live ducks, a goat, and, of course, the Bull Inn! Entertainment was there on a village stage, and this was good. Crown Meadow, my school did some dancing. There was a comedian with a funny hat on, and a lively band. There were some sheep, great big things, not cuddly! The bulls were huge, one was bigger than me. Even the rabbits were large. The goat was nice, it licked anyone that went near it. The tractors went to and fro. I was sad when we had to leave.
